item.title: Realtime Semantic Segmentation
item.description: We developed a real-time semantic segmentation models for identifying humans in video streams across web, Windows, and macOS. Designed a comprehensive library, abstracting complex tasks such as pre and post-processing and multithreading, allowing seamless client integration. This impactful project significantly enhanced the efficiency and ease of deploying advanced segmentation capabilities in diverse applications, without clients navigating the technical depths.

item.title: Semantic segmentation for autonomous vehicles
item.description: We worked on an autonomous delivery robot project, focusing on real-time semantic segmentation for autonomous driving on edge devices. Our model adeptly handled a range of environmental challenges, including varying weather conditions and day-to-night transitions, ensuring robust and reliable robot navigation.

item.title: Parcel recognition system in warehouses
item.description: A parcel detection and tracking system, tailored for efficient parcel management in expansive warehouses. The project entailed training robust models and crafting an efficient library to ensure real-time functionality within high-resolution camera networks.

item.title: Patient monitoring - action recognition
item.description: An action recognition system tailored for monitoring senior individuals in nursing homes. The model was adept at observing the well-being of residents, especially those with dementia and Alzheimer’s disease, by proficiently detecting routine actions, such as breakfast preparation, ensuring consistent care and early anomaly detection.
